post.body: Well, that's too bad. Now, if the fudge sampler fell in, that would be a tragedy.
LOL I rented that for my kids to watch tonight. I am far more excited than they, but they'll thank me later. "Tomorrow", maybe.
We used to let the kids watch the ball drop in eastern time. They're on to us now, though. :)
Let's not make fun of Steve Camp and Amy Grant, Sir Mix-a-lot.
You are cracking me up. I live north of LA, and yes we think it's cold. :) And no, no one carpools. Hence the jams and smog. :(
Me, too!! Listening to him now...much to my husband's dismay. :)
I just saw you on Beth Moore's scripture memory thing, and it said Clackamas. My dad used to live in Canby. Isn't that near?
LOL How thoughtful.
Wow. At least you didn't have to rent a tux. ??
Paint your nails.
You and your laundromat could be a new Bravo show.
Do you know who I love? Garrison Keillor. More proof that I'm a 70 yo trapped in a 32 yo body.
I'm excited to go back to paper calendars this year. I'm just not cool enough for you, iCal. Hope Andy still loves me.
Barnes and Noble with a gift card. Life does not get better.
Talkin' 'bout Oklahoma, y'all...http://www.amystorms.com/
My neighbor gave me the Best. Toffee. Ever. And I can't. Stop. Eating it.
Okay twitter/FB friends, name the artist: "Our music is noise, our worship is play when we hold on to our old lives of si-ii-in."
"Mom, what do you think is gonna happen to the button I swallowed?" ??
Last night I dreamt I was playing Pathwords. I kept spelling words all night. I may need an intervention.
Andy has been watching the Matrix movies lately and I have NOT A CLUE what happens. I try to pay attention, really, but wow. ZZZZzzzz...
